measurableElement.name: Facility provide services under National program for prevention and control of deafness
Facility provides service under Mental Health Program as per guidelines
Facility provides service under National AIDS Control program as per guidelines
Facility provides service under National programme for the health care of the elderly as per guidelines
Facility provide service for Integrated disease surveillance program
Facility provides service under National Vector Borne Disease Control Program as per guidelines
Facility provides service under National Leprosy Eradication Program as per guidelines
Facility provides service under National Programme for Prevention and Control of cancer, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases & stroke (NPCDCS) as per guidelines
Facility provides service under Revised National TB Control Program as per guidelines
The facility has standard procedures for handling the death in the hospital
The facility has standard operating procedure for end of life support
The facility has standard procedures for conducting post-mortem, its recording and meeting its obligation under the law
Death of admitted patient is adequately recorded and communicated
Case summary and follow-up instructions are provided at the discharge
The facility has established procedure for patients leaving the facility against medical advice, absconding, etc
Counselling services are provided as during discharges wherever required
Discharge is done after assessing patient readiness
There is established procedure for issuing blood
There is established procedure for transfusion of blood
Blood bank has defined and implemented donor selection criteria
There is established procedure for preparation of blood component
There is established procedure for storage of blood
There is established the compatibility testing
There is established procedure for the testing of blood
There is establish procedure for labelling and identification of blood and its product
There is established procedure for the collection of blood
There is a established procedure for monitoring and reporting Transfusion complication
There is an established procedure for Post partum counselling of mother
There is established procedure for discharge and follow up of mother and newborn.
The facility has established procedures for stabilization/treatment/referral of post natal complications
Post partum Care is provided to the mothers
The facility ensures adequate stay of mother and newborn in a safe environment as per standard Protocols.
Facility is connected to medical colleges through telemedicine services
Facility provides appropriate referral linkages to the patients/Services for transfer to other/higher facilities to assure their continuity of care.
A person is identified for care during all steps of care
Facility has established procedure for continuity of care during interdepartmental transfer
The facility has defined and established procedure for intensive care
The facility has explicit clinical criteria for providing intubation & extubation, and care of patients on ventilation and subsequently on its removal
The facility has established procedure for shifting the patient to step-down/ward based on explicit assessment criteria
There are established procedures for Pre-testing Activities
There are established procedures for testing Activities
There are established procedures for Post-testing Activities
There is a system to ensure right medicine is given to right patient
Medication orders are written legibly and adequately
There is a procedure to check drug before administration/ dispensing
There is process for identifying and cautious administration of high alert drugs
Patient is counselled for self drug administration
There is an established procedure for identification of High risk pregnancy and appropriate treatment/referral as per scope of services.
There is an established procedure for Registration and follow up of pregnant women.
There is an established procedure for identification and management of moderate and severe anaemia
Counselling of pregnant women is done as per standard protocol and gestational age
Facility ensures availability of diagnostic and drugs during antenatal care of pregnant women
There is an established procedure for History taking, Physical examination, and counselling for each antenatal visit.

Management of children with severe
Acute Malnutrition is done as per guidelines

Management of children presenting
diarrhoea is done per guidelines
The facility provides immunization services as per guidelines

Management of children presenting
with fever, cough/ breathlessness is done as per guidelines
Management of neonatal asphyxia, jaundice and sepsis is done as per guidelines

Triage, Assessment & Management of newborns having 
emergency signs are done as per guidelines

Management of Low birth weight
newborns is done as per guidelines
Facility ensures standard practices and materials for decontamination and clean ing of instruments and procedures areas
Facility ensures standard practices and materials for disinfection and sterilization of instruments and equipments
Facility ensures adequate personal protection equipments as per requirements
Staff is adhere to standard personal protection practices
Facility ensures availability of standard materials for cleaning and disinfection of patient care areas
Facility ensures segregation infectious patients
Facility ensures standard practices followed for cleaning and disinfection of patient care areas
The facility ensures air quality of high risk area
Layout of the department is conducive for the infection control practices
There is Provision of Periodic Medical Checkups and immunization of staff
Facility has established procedures for regular monitoring of infection control practices
Facility has provision for Passive and active culture surveillance of critical & high risk areas
The facility measures hospital associated infection rates
Facility has defined and established antibiotic policy
Facility has functional infection control committee
Facility ensures transportation and disposal of waste as per guidelines
Facility ensures management of sharps as per guidelines
Facility Ensures segregation of Bio Medical Waste as per guidelines
Facility ensures standard practices and materials for antisepsis
Hand washing facilities are provided at point of use
Staff is trained and adhere to standard hand washing practices
The facility reviews quality of its services at periodic intervals
The facility has a quality team in place
Patient Satisfaction surveys are conducted at periodic intervals
Facility prepares the action plans for the areas of low satisfaction
Facility analyses the patient feed back and do root cause analysis
Staff is trained and aware of the standard procedures written in SOPs
Work instructions are displayed at Point of use
Standard Operating Procedures adequately describes process and procedures
Departmental standard operating procedures are available
Facility has established external assurance programs at relevant departments
Facility has established internal quality assurance program at relevant departments
Facility has established system for use of check lists in different departments and services
Facility uses method for quality improvement in services
Facility uses tools for quality improvement in services
Facility takes corrective action to improve the processes
Facility identifies non value adding activities / waste / redundant activities
Facility maps its critical processes
The facility conducts the periodic prescription/ medical/death audits
The facility ensures non compliances are enumerated and recorded adequately
The facility conducts periodic internal assessment
Action plan is made on the gaps found in the assessment / audit process
Corrective and preventive actions are taken to address issues, observed in the assessment & audit
Quality policy and objectives are disseminated and staff is aware of that
The facility periodically defines its quality objectives and key departments have their own objectives
Progress towards quality objectives is monitored periodically
The facility defines its quality policy
Facility measures Clinical Care & Safety Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures efficiency Indicators on monthly basis
Facility measures Service Quality Indicators on monthly basis
The Facility measures equity indicators periodically
Facility measures productivity Indicators on monthly basis
Hospital has a system for periodic maintenance of infrastructure at pre-defined interval
Hospital has intact boundary wall and functional gates at entry
Electric wiring and Fittings are maintained
Hospital Infrastructure is well maintained
No junk material in Open Areas and corridors
No junk material in critical service area
Hospital has documented and implemented Condemnation policy
No junk material in patient care areas
Hospital has demarcated space for keeping condemned junk material
No stray animals within the facility premises
Measures for Mosquito free environment are in place
Cattle-trap is installed at the entrance
Pest Control Measures are implemented in the facility
Anti-termite Treatment of the wooden furniture and fixtures is undertaken periodically
No thoroughfare / general traffic in hospital premises
There is no abandoned / dilapidated building within the premises
No water logging in open areas
Open areas are well maintained
There is no unauthorised occupation within the facility, nor there is encroachment on Hospital land
Adequate illumination in front of hospital and access road
Adequate illumination in Circulation Area
Adequate illumination in Procedure Areas (Labour Room/ OT)
Use of energy efficient bulbs
Adequate illumination in Indoor Areas
Interior of patient care areas are plastered & painted
Name of the hospital is prominently displayed at the entrance
Uniform signage system in the Hospital
Walls are well-plastered and painted
No unwanted/Outdated posters
Window and doors are maintained
There is a system of preventive maintenance of furniture and fixtures
Patient Beds & Mattresses are in good condition
Furniture at the nursing station, staff room, administrative office are maintained
Trolleys, Stretchers, Wheel Chairs, etc. are well maintained
Water supply system is maintained in the Hospital
Hospital promotes water conservation
Water supply is adequate in Quantity & Quality
Hospital has a functional rain water harvesting system
There is a system of periodical inspection for water wastage
Gardens/ green area are secured with fence
Internal Roads, Pathways, waiting area, etc. are uneven and clean
Green Areas/ Parks/ Open spaces are well maintained
Provision of Herbal Garden
Facility’s front area is landscaped
Staff periodically sort useful and unnecessary articles at work station
Staff label the articles in identifiable manner
The Staff arrange the useful articles, records in systematic manner
Staff has been trained for work place management
Work stations are clean and free of dirt/dust
Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a week.
No dirt/Grease/ Stains/ Garbage in Procedure Areas
No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Seepage in OT & Labour Room
OT & Labour Room Tables are without grease, body fluid and dust
OT/Labour Room floors and procedures surfaces are cleaned at least twice a day / after every surgery
Floors of Toilets are Dry
Sinks and Cistern are cleaned every two hours or whenever required
No foul smell in the Toilets
Toilets have running water and functional cistern
No dirt/Grease/Stains/ Garbage in Toilets
Use of separate mops for critical and semi critical areas and procedures surfaces
Use unidirectional method and out word mopping
Disinfection and washing of mops after every cleaning cycle
Use of Three bucket system for cleaning
No use of brooms in patient care areas
Wards are cleaned at least thrice in the day with wet mop
Patient Furniture, Mattresses, Fixtures are without grease and dust
No dirt/Grease/ Stains/ Garbage in wards
Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a week.
No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Dust/Seepage on walls and roofs of wards
Furniture & Fixtures are without grease and dust and cleaned daily
Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a month
No dirt/Grease/ Stains/ Garbage in Auxiliary Area
Auxiliary Areas are cleaned at least twice in the day with wet mop
No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Seepage on walls and roofs of Auxiliary Area
Floors, walls, furniture and fixture are thoroughly cleaned once in a week.
Ambulatory Areas are cleaned at least thrice in the day with wet mop
No Cobwebs/Bird Nest/ Seepage on walls and roofs of ambulatory area
No dirt/Grease/Stains / Garbage in Ambulatory Area
Furniture, & Fixtures are without grease and dust and cleaned daily
Availability of carbolic Acid/ Bacilocid for surface cleaning in procedure areas- OT, Labour Room
Availability of Cleaning Equipment
Cleaning staff uses correct concentration of cleaning solution
Availability of Detergent Disinfectant solution / Hospital Grade Phenyl for Cleaning purpose
Availability of Buckets and carts for Mopping
Use of Housekeeping Checklist in Procedure Areas
Monitoring of adequacy and quality of material used for cleaning
A person is designated for monitoring of Housekeeping Activities
Use of Housekeeping Checklist in Patient Care Areas
